title: R ggplot2 demo
text:
Figure 1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess")





Figure 1: Temperature and ozone level.

title: Python demo
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: About
text:
I am Aleix Alcacer, a predoctoral researcher at Jaume I University that loves the open-source world.
I like to develop new algorithms focusing on both performance and efficiency. Currently, I am designing new methods for the archetypal analysis.
